datapoints.description:
Reports the DaysRemaining metric if the certificate isn't self signed.
Use this datapoint to alert in circumstances where you aren't interested in the expiry status of self signed certificates.
datapoints.alertBody:
##INSTANCE## Certificate on ##HOST## is not self signed and will be expiring in ##VALUE## days, placing the certificate into ##LEVEL## state.

This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoints.name: Alerting_DaysRemainingIfNotSelfSigned

datapoints.description:
Reports the DaysRemaining metric if the certificate is self signed.
Use this datapoint to alert in circumstances where you aren't interested in the expiry status of certificates that aren't self signed.
datapoints.alertBody:
##INSTANCE## Certificate on ##HOST## is self signed and will be expiring in ##VALUE## days, placing the certificate into ##LEVEL## state.

This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoints.name: Alerting_DaysRemainingIfSelfSigned

datapoints.description: Number of certificates in the SSL chain.
datapoints.name: ChainLength

datapoints.description:
Indicator for connection reset exception.

1=The certificate has failed due to a connection reset. This is commonly due to a security or configuration issue such as a firewall and doesn't necessarily mean the certificate is invalid.
0=The certificate does not have this issue.
-1=An issue was not reported, but could still exist if other issues are obscuring it.
datapoints.alertBody:
##INSTANCE## Certificate on ##HOST## is failing standard SSL security checks, placing the certificate into ##LEVEL## state.

This error is commonly due to a security or configuration issue such as a firewall.

This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoints.name: ConnectionReset

datapoints.description: Time remaining until the certificate expires, in days.
datapoints.alertBody:
##INSTANCE## Certificate on ##HOST## is expiring in ##VALUE## days, placing the certificate into ##LEVEL## state.

This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoints.name: DaysRemaining

datapoints.description:
Indicator for hostname mismatch exception.

1=The certificate failed host name validation checks.
0=The certificate does not have this issue.
-1=An issue was not reported, but could still exist if other issues are obscuring it.
datapoints.name: HostNameMismatch

datapoints.description:
Indicator for invalid certification path exception.

1=The certification path is invalid (Untrusted Root etc).
0=The certificate does not have this issue.
-1=An issue was not reported, but could still exist if other issues are obscuring it.
datapoints.name: InvalidCertificationPath

datapoints.description:
Indicator for whether an unknown exception occurred.

1=The certificate has failed validation without enough information to accurately report the issue. See the debug output for details.
0=The certificate does not have any unknown issues.
-1=An issue was not reported, but could still exist if other issues are obscuring it.
datapoints.name: OtherException

datapoints.description:
Indicator for self issued certificates.

1=The certificate appears to be self issued.
0=The certificate does not have this issue.
-1=An issue was not reported, but could still exist if other issues are obscuring it.
datapoints.alertBody:
##INSTANCE## Certificate on ##HOST## is failing SSL security checks due to a self issued certificate, placing the certificate into ##LEVEL## state. 

This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoints.name: SelfIssuedCertificate

datapoints.description:
Indicator for self signed certificates.

1=The certificate appears to be self signed.
0=The certificate does not have this issue.
-1=An issue was not reported, but could still exist if other issues are obscuring it.
datapoints.alertBody:
##INSTANCE## Certificate on ##HOST## is failing SSL security checks due to a self signed certificate, placing the certificate into ##LEVEL## state. 

This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoints.name: SelfSignedCertificate

datapoints.description:
Indicator for timestamp check exception.

1=The timestamp is invalid (expired or otherwise).
0=The certificate does not have this issue.
-1=An issue was not reported, but could still exist if other issues are obscuring it.
datapoints.alertBody:
##INSTANCE## Certificate on ##HOST## is failing SSL security checks due to an invalid timestamp, placing the certificate into ##LEVEL## state. 

This error is commonly associated with certificate expiry.

This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoints.name: TimestampCheckFailed

datapoints.description:
Indicator for whether hostname or IP was used.

1=The hostname was unknown so we had to fallback to using one of the device ips.
0=The hostname was known.
datapoints.name: UnknownHostIPFallback

datapoints.description:
Indicator for unrecognized name exception.

1=The certificate failed with an unrecognized name during the handshake. The host IP was used as an alternative in an attempt to still get expiry stats.
0=The certificate does not have this issue.
datapoints.name: UnrecognisedName

datapoints.description:
Indicator whether certificate is valid.

1=Certificates passed all validation.
0=Issue discovered during validation.
datapoints.name: Valid

description: Monitors SSL validity information across ports specified in the property custom.ssl_listening_ports
technicalNotes:
Performs port scan during Active Discovery.
custom.ssl_listening_ports should have this syntax:
80|HTTP,443|HTTPS,445|CMS Web Admin
name: SSL_Certificates_Custom
